comments.body:
Do you know how thread friendly is `put` here? Is it going to block and not return until the object has been put to geode?

I was thinking that we could use `put(K key, V value, Object aCallbackArgument)` here and only `pull` when the stage gets called back. WDYT?

It is blocking (hence the IO dispatcher). The aCallbackArgument, is a serializable argument that will be given to callback *inside* the grid (if they are configured).
AFAIK there is no async / no-blocking client yet.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@          val msg = grab(in)

          put(msg)

          push(out, msg)
